identificationModule.officialTitle: Sleep Education for Elders Program Evaluation

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study tests the effectiveness of a new educational intervention designed to improve sleep outcomes among an older adult population.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Analyses will be done by blinded assessor.

armGroups.label: Experimental
armGroups.description: Participants who participated in the SLEEP program.

armGroups.label: Control
armGroups.description: Participants who did not participate in the SLEEP program.

interventions.name: SLEEP program
interventions.description: SLEEP is a 6-week educational program designed to improve sleep hygiene and habits.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Sleep quality: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
primaryOutcomes.description: Change in sleep quality as measured by Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index. Scores range from 0-21 with higher scores representing worse outcomes.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Sleep quality: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
primaryOutcomes.description: Change in sleep quality as measured by Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index. Scores range from 0-21 with higher scores representing worse outcomes.
Change in sleep duration (hours and minutes) as measured by Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
Change in sleep duration (hours and minutes) as measured by Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
Change in daytime sleepiness measured by Epworth Sleepiness Scale. Scale scoring ranges from 0-24, with higher scores indicating worse outcomes.
Change in daytime sleepiness measured by Epworth Sleepiness Scale. Scale scoring ranges from 0-24, with higher scores indicating worse outcomes.
As measured by Insomnia Severity Index. Scores range from 0-28 with higher scores indicating worse outcomes.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: immediately after the program and six months later

primaryOutcomes.description: As measured by Insomnia Severity Index. Scores range from 0-28 with higher scores indicating worse outcomes.
As measured by Sleep Hygiene Index. Scores range from 0-52 with higher scores indicating worse outcomes.
As measured by Sleep Hygiene Index. Scores range from 0-52 with higher scores indicating worse outcomes.

secondaryOutcomes.description: As measured by several questions related to sleep health and hygiene
As measured by several questions related to sleep health and hygiene

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Sleep satisfaction: questions measuring personal satisfaction with sleep quality and duration
secondaryOutcomes.description: As measured by questions measuring personal satisfaction with sleep quality and duration

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Sleep satisfaction: questions measuring personal satisfaction with sleep quality and duration
secondaryOutcomes.description: As measured by questions measuring personal satisfaction with sleep quality and duration

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Program satisfaction: questions and comments related to program experiences
secondaryOutcomes.description: As measured by questions and comments related to program experiences

secondaryOutcomes.description: As measured by questions and comments related to program experiences

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* participants who choose to enroll in the SLEEP program

Exclusion Criteria:

* younger than 40 years of age
